intro: Chaetaria canariensis, commonly known as the Canary Islands heath, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
